concise_definition: n. 冲突, 碰撞, 对立; v. (clash 的第三人称单数形式) 冲突, 碰撞, 发生抵触

definitions.explanation_en: A violent or forceful collision between two or more objects, people, or ideas, often resulting in conflict or opposition.
definitions.explanation_cn: 两个或多个物体、人或观点之间发生的激烈碰撞，通常导致冲突或对立。
definitions.example_en: The clash of cymbals echoed through the concert hall.
definitions.example_cn: 铙钹的撞击声在音乐厅中回荡。

definitions.explanation_en: A strong disagreement or conflict between people, groups, or ideologies, especially when values, interests, or opinions are incompatible.
definitions.explanation_cn: 人与人、群体或意识形态之间强烈的分歧或冲突，尤其当价值观、利益或观点不相容时。
definitions.example_en: There was a major clash between the union and management over wage increases.
definitions.example_cn: 工会与管理层在加薪问题上发生了重大冲突。

definitions.explanation_en: A striking contrast or incompatibility in appearance, style, or color, often creating visual tension.
definitions.explanation_cn: 在外观、风格或颜色上形成的鲜明对比或不协调，常造成视觉上的紧张感。
definitions.example_en: The clash of bright red and neon green made the outfit look chaotic.
definitions.example_cn: 鲜红与霓虹绿的搭配让这套服装显得杂乱无章。

definitions.explanation_en: To collide forcefully, especially with a loud noise, as two objects or people come into contact.
definitions.explanation_cn: 猛烈地碰撞，尤指两个物体或人接触时发出响亮的声音。
definitions.example_en: The two cars clashed head-on at the intersection.
definitions.example_cn: 两辆车在十字路口迎头相撞。

definitions.explanation_en: To be in direct and often hostile opposition, especially in ideas, beliefs, or interests.
definitions.explanation_cn: 在思想、信念或利益上直接且常常是敌对地对立。
definitions.example_en: Her views on education clash with those of the school board.
definitions.example_cn: 她对教育的看法与校董会的观点相冲突。

comparison.analysis: “Conflict” (冲突) 是更广泛、更抽象的术语，涵盖所有形式的对立，包括心理、政治、军事或人际层面。它不强调物理碰撞或声音，而 “clash” 更常用于描述激烈、突然、有声响或视觉冲击的对抗，尤其在物理或风格层面。
“Collision” (碰撞) 通常指物理上的撞击，强调物体之间的力学接触，多用于交通、工程或科学语境。而 “clash” 除了物理碰撞外，更常用于抽象冲突（如观点、文化）和比喻性表达（如颜色冲突），语义范围更广。
“Disagreement” (分歧) 指意见不一致，语气较温和，不一定伴随情绪或对抗。而 “clash” 暗示更强烈的情绪、对抗性甚至暴力倾向，常用于描述激烈、公开的对立，语义强度更高。
